titles.title: Stand with Israel Act of 2014
A bill to prohibit certain assistance to the Palestinian Authority.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

term.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary:
4/29/2014--Introduced. Stand with Israel Act of 2014 - Prohibits any direct U.S. assistance, loan guarantee, or debt relief to the Palestinian Authority (PA) or any affiliated governing entity or leadership organization.
States that such prohibition shall have no effect for a fiscal year if the President certifies to Congress that during such fiscal year the PA has: (1) formally recognized Israel's right to exist as a Jewish state, (2) publicly recognized the state of Israel, (3) renounced terrorism, (4) purged all individuals with terrorist ties from security services, (5) terminated funding of anti-American and anti-Israel incitement, (6) publicly pledged to not engage in war with Israel, and (7) honored previous diplomatic agreements.
